root_causes: The expected DK-detection step (CheckDK3D('B5cx1','B5cDKx1')) is not invoked; the script relies only on MISSING(B5cDKx1) without ensuring B5cDKx1 has been populated by a DK scan.
The DO REPEAT block is not terminated with an END REPEAT, so the per-cell checks inside the DO REPEAT will not execute as intended (syntax/logic gap).
instructions: Call the DK detection routine before running the autosum check. Insert a call like: CheckDK3D('B5cx1','B5cDKx1'). This ensures B5cDKx1 is set when any DK codes are present in the subcells.
Close the DO REPEAT block. Add END REPEAT after the IF statements inside the DO REPEAT to ensure per-cell range and any-answer checks actually execute.

Ensure the autosum check uses the DK detection result populated by CheckDK3D. Keep the condition IF (QuestionErrors_B5cx1 = 0 AND MISSING(B5cDKx1) AND S7_1 > 0 AND ABS(B5cx1_sum - S7_1) > 0.0005) B5cx1_sum_err = 1; but only after CheckDK3D has been run.
Optionally, remove or use the B5cx1_any_answer variable (currently computed but unused) or ensure its intended usage is implemented consistently with other validation logic.
